**Shapes**

**About the application**

This is a simple application where user can mark three markers on the screen and a parallelogram can be created joining these markers. User can click on the circle button to create a circle with parallelogram&#39;s center of mass as it&#39;s center and area same as that of the parallelogram

**How to use**

Node and npm is needed to run the application. On cmd run &#39;npm install&#39; command to install the npm modules. Once done run &#39;npm run start&#39; to run the application

User can mark three markers on the left section of the application. The right section of the application provides the information regarding the coordinates of all the markers and area of the parallelogram and circle

There are three buttons on the right side section of the application

 ![](data:image/*;base64,)

The parallelogram button can be used to create the parallelogram through the three markers, the parallelogram won&#39;t be created if there are less than three markers on the screen

The circle button can be used to create the circle with parallelogram&#39;s center of mass as it&#39;s center and area same as that of the parallelogram. The circle will not be created if the parallelogram is not present on the screen

The reset button can be used to clear all the markers and clear the screen

**Application structure**

This is a react+ES6 application, webpack is being used for build and application rendering

The application code is  structured as followed

-src

-index.html

-index.css

---app

---index.js

---initialState.js

------utils

------components

------containers

All the stateful components are the part of containers directory and the stateless components are contained in components directory

utils contain a HOC (draggable) for making any component draggable and updating it&#39;s coordinates.

**Areas of improvement**

- State management: currently the application state is being maintained in the statefull components and being passed down to the functional components,  redux/flux can be used to create a central state for the application
- Styling: The application has a very basic styling. I have used styled-components and react-bootstrap for the styling
- Unit testing: Though I have created testable components, unit testing is not being implemented currently
- Buid config: very basic configuration for webpack is done
